headline: Kentucky Blue Ribbon All-Butter Pound Cake
description: The recipe for this all-butter pound cake has been passed down for generations and was awarded a blue ribbon at the Kentucky State Fair.
name: Kentucky Blue Ribbon All-Butter Pound Cake

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a tube pan with some butter and dust lightly with flour.
Mix flour, baking powder, and salt together in a bowl.

Combine sugar and butter in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until creamy. Add eggs one at a time, beating well between each addition. Beat in flour mixture alternately with milk. Mix in vanilla extract. Pour batter into the prepared tube pan.

Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, 1 hour to 1 hour 30 minutes. Cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Invert onto a wire rack and let cool completely, about 30 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I've made this cake for decades, and it's wonderful. I do change the flavors. Instead of vanilla I add 2 tsp. lemon extract and 2 tsp, almond extract. I also add the eggs one at a time, beating the batter until it thickens a bit.
I MADE THIS CAKE, ITS REALLY GOOD! JUST NEED A LIL MORE FLAVOR. BUT OVERALL A GOOD CAKE. I MADE VANILLA ICING FOR IT TOO.

This was a easy recipe to put together. It was delicious and my family destroyed it. I did use butter milk in stead of regular milk, I only did that because I like the texture of the cake when you use buttermilk. I will make again.
I loved this simple recipe, my daughter asked for a confetti pound cake, i used this recipe and i added cake batter flavoring and ice cream jimmies
I've taken this to work several times and it went within a few hours. It's requested time and time again by co-workers. I like that is doesn't require buttermilk!

I was a little short on the sugar because I ran out and didn't want to go to the store. Even with less sugar this was really good. Moist inside and a little crisp on the outside. It was done in 1 hour 20 minutes. I took half to my husband's office and he said it was gone in a few minutes. Definite keeper.
Thank you for sharing your precious recipe! So many others are unwilling to do so. I know you are proud of this special recipe!
was so easy to make and tastes great. Second time making this cake each time it was so moist. My go to pound cake.
cut back on sugar, use toasted spelt flour substituted for one cup of regular flour, baked for around 1 hour. The cake smells so good, and you could tasted the caramelized crust on the outside.
Love the cake. My husband and I make it together. It's something we can do together and both enjoy afterwards. Wonder has anyone ever tried adding chocolate to the batter?
After reading the reviews, I prepared the recipe with a lower amount of sugar. I used 2 and 1/4 cups. zi otherwise followed the recipe exactly, and it was perfect. Will make it again.
I am going to make it again
Added 1/2 t almond extract. Did not need anything but a dusting of powdered sugar. Delicious!
I changed nothing, it was delicious!
I like this pound cake it is rich and buttery.
Outstanding- my family loved it!
Cut down on sugar
Best recipe EVER and the only pound cake recipe I use.
This cake is always hit every time!

I made sure to mix butter and sugar for 5 minutes before putting in one egg at a time, And only had whole wheat flour to lightly flour Bundt pan with. I have convection oven so I only had to bake for 65 minutes followed remainder of recipe!!! 
YUM AZING!!! Everyone in my Family also loved it! Thank you for sharing your family All Butter pound cake recipe
I made it a second time It's like soup
Wonderful pound cake! I made the recipe as written, and in my opinion, it's exactly as a pound cake should be. This is a keeper!
My husband loves this recipe! I have made it several times and it always turns out great!! Thank you!!!
No changes. REALLY tasty, moist cake.
It was delicious!
Absolutely fantastic .. didn't change a thing!

This one is going right into the baking rotation in my kitchen. I made it just like the recipe and it was FABULOUS. The family loved it. I baked it for 1 hour and 15 minutes and it was perfect. Make sure you cool it for 5 minutes and then take out of the pan so it doesn’t stick.
Very yummy.
I've made it twice, excellent the first time without changes, excellent the second time using coconut extract instead of vanilla, and adding 1 cup of shredded coconut.
It was time consuming, but it turned out great. No changes made.
results in a large pound cake that is moist, firm and delicious. Again and again.
This was AWESOME! Followed the recipe exactly except for we don't have a bundt cake pan so we put it in 2 loaf pans. Baked for 70 minutes. Delicious. Thank you for the recipe.

This is my second time making this pound cake, and everyone loves it! It’s easy to put together, I put in all the dry ingredients and mix together, then put the butter in and turn the mixer on low and let it come together, then ad the milk, then eggs and vanilla. Turn the mixer up a little, let it all come together, turn it up and beat until it’s fluffy. Perfect!

Perfection! It doesn’t get any better than this! Be sure to beat the butter and sugar for at least 5 minutes, and when you alternate the flour mixture with milk, begin and end with flour. Mine baked 75 minutes in a Bundt pan. Truly delicious!
This was the BEST cake ever! All I did different was add a smidge more vanilla. The cake tasted better as each day went by--incredible! But it did not last too many days--hahahaha!

II've been looking for  a GOOD pound cake recipe for years. THIS THE BEST POUND CAKE I'VE EVER MADE!!!
Even the dogs are hoping Ill drop some crumbs or even a whole piece...Its not begging it being optimistic and helpful. I only changed one thing and that is I like almond extract instead of vanilla. As I said I have been looking for a Good pound cake recipe and this is it. I know that I can add or change things up as I like because the base for it is perfect. So i would recommend this cake to anyone. 

Yes In less than a week I made this extraordinary cake again. This time I tweaked it to my tastes and replace 1 c of flour with coconut flour and used half and half instead of milk . I also added an additional egg yolk. This really is a blue ribbon winner recipe and it will be adopted as a nowden family recipe
I followed the recipes and it came out great !
Delicious
But I did a twist, I used sugar instead of flour to coat the pan, and I add the zest of 2 lemon and the juice of 1.
This is THE best pound cake I have ever had or made. Thank you.
My first perfect pound cake! Didn’t change a thing. Thank you!
Swapped dairy free butter and lactaid milk and added a tsp lemon extract and it was wonderful cooked up perfect.
I followed the recipe making no changes. I will definitely make it again. A very moist pound cake. I always make a pound cake in a very long loaf pan by Wilton.
I made no changes, yes I will make it again...thank you.

This is a very good recipe. One to surely be a family tradition. I did cut the sugar back to 2 1/2 cups vs. 3. Other than that, it’s perfect. Thank you for sharing this now to be our family favorite tradition! Blessings!

Delicious pound cake! I cut off all the edges and cubed them, and used the cubes in a berry trifle dish for a dessert auction I participated in tonight. Cubes of this pound cake layered with homemade whipped cream and berries. Built the dessert in a clear plastic trifle dish, and it was gorgeous! Traditionally, pound cake uses a pound of butter, a pound of sugar and a pound of flour...the measurements for these ingredients were off that ratio for this recipe, but I still liked it very much! Thanks for sharing your family recipe!

item.name: Kentucky Blue Ribbon All-Butter Pound Cake
